TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a citizen of GPE , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was an employee of the NORP company “ Graditelj ” , in GPE , GPE . On DATE he had an accident at his workplace and suffered injuries . Since then he has mostly been on sick - leave . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant obtained a certificate from ORG ( Republički fond zdravstvene zaštite PERSON ) that ORG covered sick - leave allowance regardless of the applicants’ place of living . The applicant left GPE some time in the autumn of DATE and went to live in GPE .
On DATE the company sent him a letter informing him that they had terminated his contract of employment as of CARDINAL DATE since ORG had refused to pay his sick - leave allowance .
On DATE the applicant claimed a sick - leave allowance as from CARDINAL DATE before ORG , ORG ( ORG fond zdravstvenog osiguranja i zdravstva ORG Polje ) . He relied on ORG certificate .

This request was rejected on DATE by ORG in PERSON . It was found that the applicant received sick - leave allowance for the period from CARDINAL DATE until DATE . The last time he had attended an examination before a medical experts’ commission in charge of grating sick - leave was on DATE . After that he had left for GPE . The ORG did not accept medical certificates from GPE because , according to NORP laws , the applicant had to present himself in person before a medical experts’ commission in GPE in order to have his sick - leave prolonged .
On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision to ORG ( PERSON republičkog fonda zdravstvenog osiguranja i zdravstva Hrvatske ) .
According to the applicant , on DATE and DATE , respectively , he lodged requests with ORG for speeding up the proceedings . He received no reply .

As the above Commission failed to decide upon the applicant ’s appeal , on DATE he instituted administrative proceedings in ORG Upravni Sud PERSON ) asking it to decide the matter . On DATE he lodged a request for speeding up the proceedings , but received no reply . It appears that the proceedings are still pending before that court .

According to the Government on DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal of DATE . Since the postal services with GPE at that time were interrupted , the decision was placed on the ORG ’s public notice - board .

As regards the applicant ’s claim before ORG , the Government submit that on DATE the court invited the applicant to inform it whether he wished to extend his claim against the second instance decision .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Zakon o upravnim sporovima ) allows an applicant to lodge a claim in ORG if an appellate body does not issue a decision upon his appeal within DATE followed by DATE upon the applicant ’s repeated request .
Section CARDINAL of the same LAW provides that ORG must either instruct the lower bodies on how to resolve the case or resolve the case itself .

Section CARDINAL of LAW on the Changes of LAW on FAC ( entered into force on DATE , published in ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE - hereinafter “ LAW DATE ” - PERSON o izmjenama i dopunama PERSON zakona o PERSON sudu PERSON ) introduced a new Section CARDINAL ( a ) , which subsequently became LAW of LAW on ORG . The relevant parts of that Section read as follows :

( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint even before all legal remedies have been exhausted in cases when a competent court has not decided within a reasonable time a claim concerning the applicant ’s rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him ...

( CARDINAL ) If the constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this Section is accepted , the ORG shall determine a time - limit within which a competent court shall decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision under paragraph CARDINAL of this LAW , the Constitutional Court shall fix appropriate compensation for the applicant in respect of the violation found concerning his constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid from the ORG budget within a term of DATE from the date when the party lodged a request for its payment .
